result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Kuehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 292 Days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 5 and Case 16CF325

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision, before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

No Contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriated. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael R Kuehl in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes Statements. Court addresses date of violation on 16CF325. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#4:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

7.5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 292 days)	***CONCURRENT TO COUNT #5 AND 16CF325***
  -  2.5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims listed in the Criminal Complaint. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $56.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge. (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Sheriff Department within (3) business days to provide DNA sample

COUNT#5:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

7.5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 292 days)	***CONCURRENT TO COUNT #4 AND 16CF325***
  -  2.5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims listed in the Criminal Complaint. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael R Kuehl in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #4 & 5.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #4 & 5.  Counts #1, 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Court adjourns sentencing due to having just received 19 page report from defense.  Parties present for sentencing makes statements today.  Sarah K. makes statements on behalf of Defendant.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Bail is revoked.
